page.title: 17IBSTOCK - FAMOUS FOR BRICKS
page.content: It is not surprising that anyone who thinks of{Ibstock}thinks of bricks. For the works that have brought a certain amount of fame to the village makes an incredible sixty million bricks a year. The four hundred acre site of Ibstock Building Products Ltd., as the company is known today, lies on the outskirts of the village on the road to Ellistown. The site is unique in that it has three distinct and separate layers of clay - white, buff and red - and all three main brick-making techniques take place there - handmade, pressed and extruded. The site originated in 1825 when the major part of the business was coal-mining. The small brickworks would only be intended to provide bricks for the mine workings.
